description: Crisp-edged, tender-roasted sweet potatoes seasoned simply with oil, salt and warm spices — served as a snack, side dish, or part of a meal.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Sweet potatoes are a common, affordable staple across Uganda. Roasting brings out their natural sweetness and is a popular street-food and home-cooked preparation.

ingredients.item: fresh lime or lemon (optional, for serving)
honey or brown sugar (optional, for glaze)

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Line a baking tray with parchment paper or lightly oil it.
Scrub sweet potatoes thoroughly. Leave skins on for texture and nutrients, or peel if preferred. Cut into wedges or 2 cm-thick slices for even roasting.
In a mixing bowl, toss sweet potato pieces with oil, salt, pepper and paprika (if using) until evenly coated.
Arrange pieces in a single layer on the tray, leaving space between pieces so they roast rather than steam.
Roast for 30–40 minutes, turning once halfway through, until edges are golden and centers are tender when pierced with a fork.
If using, toss the hot potatoes with a small knob of butter or a drizzle of honey to glaze. Squeeze fresh lime or lemon over before serving for brightness.
Serve hot as a snack or side with stews, grilled meats, or salads.

serving_suggestions: Serve with a dollop of spiced yogurt, grilled fish or stews, or enjoy plain as a filling snack.
